data: DERM AMB tPUVA Maintenance (M3) q3weekly for 4 month (Day of Treatment)
Patient Care
Refer to PUVA Treatment Protocol
Phototherapy tPUVA Hands and/or Feet Treatment
Not Applicable, 0.5, 15, J/cm2, Minimum amount of time between exposures is 72 hours. Start at 0.5 J/cm2 or 1.0 J/cm2 for dark skin pigmentation. Advance as per DST up to a maximum of 15 J/cm2
Medications
Patient to apply own supply of pre-medications  Nurse to confirm patient applied methoxsalen in DERMABASE 0.1% or 0.5% topical ointment (as prescribed) to effected area 1.5 hours before treatment
methoxsalen in DERMABASE 0.1% topical ointment
1 application, topical, once, PRN other (see comment), drug form: oint
methoxsalen in DERMABASE 0.1% topical ointment
1 application, topical, once, PRN other (see comment), drug form: oint, Dispense Take Home Medication, Dispense qty: 15 g
methoxsalen  in DERMABASE 0.5% topical ointment
1 application, topical, once, PRN other (see comment), drug form: oint
methoxsalen  in DERMABASE 0.5% topical ointment
1 application, topical, once, PRN other (see comment), drug form: oint, Dispense Take Home Medication, Dispense qty: 30 g
Zinc Oxide Cream 15%
1 application, topical, once, PRN, other (see comment), To open areas
Follow Up - Clinic - VGH Psoriasis/Phototherapy Clinic
Within 3 Months, In Person/Clinic, Phototherapy F/Up, tPUVA
Within 4 Months, In Person/Clinic, Phototherapy F/Up, tPUVA
Within 6 Months, In Person/Clinic, Phototherapy F/Up, tPUVA
DERM Ultra Violet A Treatment
